intro: Tillaea, commonly known as the rock rose, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Cistaceae. These plants are typically found in rocky or arid environments, showcasing their adaptability to harsh conditions. Tillaea species are characterized by their low-growing, mat-forming habit and their showy, often fragrant flowers. They possess hairy stems and leaves, which help reduce water loss in dry climates. The genus includes several species, some of which are used in horticulture for their ornamental value.
